intro: Beilschmiedia vohemarensis, commonly known as the Vohemare beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar, where it typically grows as an understory tree. The plant has simple, elliptic leaves with a glossy surface and a dark green color. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
